speaker: LEONATO
text: Was not Count John here at supper?

speaker:
LEONATO’S
               
              BROTHER
text: I saw him not.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: How tartly that gentleman looks! I never

speaker: BEATRICE
text: can see him but I am heartburned an hour after.

speaker: HERO
text: He is of a very melancholy disposition.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: He were an excellent man that were made

speaker: BEATRICE
text: just in the midway between him and Benedick. The

speaker: BEATRICE
text: one is too like an image and says nothing, and the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: other too like my lady’s eldest son, evermore

speaker: BEATRICE
text: tattling.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Then half Signior Benedick’s tongue in

speaker: LEONATO
text: Count John’s mouth, and half Count John’s melancholy

speaker: LEONATO
text: in Signior Benedick’s face—

speaker: BEATRICE
text: With a good leg and a good foot, uncle, and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: money enough in his purse, such a man would win

speaker: BEATRICE
text: any woman in the world if he could get her

speaker: BEATRICE
text: goodwill.

speaker: LEONATO
text: By my troth, niece, thou wilt never get thee a

speaker: LEONATO
text: husband if thou be so shrewd of thy tongue.

speaker:
LEONATO’S
               
              BROTHER
text: In faith, she’s too curst.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Too curst is more than curst. I shall lessen

speaker: BEATRICE
text: God’s sending that way, for it is said “God sends a

speaker: BEATRICE
text: curst cow short horns,” but to a cow too curst, he

speaker: BEATRICE
text: sends none.

speaker: LEONATO
text: So, by being too curst, God will send you no

speaker: LEONATO
text: horns.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Just, if He send me no husband, for the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: which blessing I am at Him upon my knees every

speaker: BEATRICE
text: morning and evening. Lord, I could not endure a

speaker: BEATRICE
text: husband with a beard on his face. I had rather lie in

speaker: BEATRICE
text: the woolen!

speaker: LEONATO
text: You may light on a husband that hath no

speaker: LEONATO
text: beard.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: What should I do with him? Dress him in my

speaker: BEATRICE
text: apparel and make him my waiting gentlewoman?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: He that hath a beard is more than a youth, and he

speaker: BEATRICE
text: that hath no beard is less than a man; and he that is

speaker: BEATRICE
text: more than a youth is not for me, and he that is less

speaker: BEATRICE
text: than a man, I am not for him. Therefore I will even

speaker: BEATRICE
text: take sixpence in earnest of the bearherd, and lead

speaker: BEATRICE
text: his apes into hell.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Well then, go you into hell?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: No, but to the gate, and there will the devil

speaker: BEATRICE
text: meet me like an old cuckold with horns on his

speaker: BEATRICE
text: head, and say “Get you to heaven, Beatrice, get you

speaker: BEATRICE
text: to heaven; here’s no place for you maids.” So deliver

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I up my apes and away to Saint Peter; for the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: heavens, he shows me where the bachelors sit, and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: there live we as merry as the day is long.

speaker:
LEONATO’S
               
              BROTHER
text: Well, niece, I trust you

speaker:
LEONATO’S
               
              BROTHER
text: will be ruled by your father.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Yes, faith, it is my cousin’s duty to make

speaker: BEATRICE
text: curtsy and say “Father, as it please you.” But yet for

speaker: BEATRICE
text: all that, cousin, let him be a handsome fellow, or

speaker: BEATRICE
text: else make another curtsy and say “Father, as it

speaker: BEATRICE
text: please me.”

speaker: LEONATO
text: Well, niece, I hope to see you one day fitted

speaker: LEONATO
text: with a husband.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Not till God make men of some other metal

speaker: BEATRICE
text: than earth. Would it not grieve a woman to be

speaker: BEATRICE
text: overmastered with a piece of valiant dust? To make

speaker: BEATRICE
text: an account of her life to a clod of wayward marl?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: No, uncle, I’ll none. Adam’s sons are my brethren,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: and truly I hold it a sin to match in my kindred.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Daughter, remember what I told

speaker: LEONATO
text: you. If the Prince do solicit you in that kind, you

speaker: LEONATO
text: know your answer.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: The fault will be in the music, cousin, if you

speaker: BEATRICE
text: be not wooed in good time. If the Prince be too

speaker: BEATRICE
text: important, tell him there is measure in everything,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: and so dance out the answer. For hear me, Hero,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: wooing, wedding, and repenting is as a Scotch jig, a

speaker: BEATRICE
text: measure, and a cinquepace. The first suit is hot and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: hasty like a Scotch jig, and full as fantastical; the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: wedding, mannerly modest as a measure, full of

speaker: BEATRICE
text: state and ancientry; and then comes repentance,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: and with his bad legs falls into the cinquepace faster

speaker: BEATRICE
text: and faster till he sink into his grave.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Cousin, you apprehend passing shrewdly.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I have a good eye, uncle; I can see a church

speaker: BEATRICE
text: by daylight.

speaker: LEONATO
text: The revelers are entering, brother. Make

speaker: LEONATO
text: good room.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Lady, will you walk a bout with your

speaker: PRINCE
text: friend?

speaker: HERO
text: So you walk softly, and look sweetly, and say

speaker: HERO
text: nothing, I am yours for the walk, and especially

speaker: HERO
text: when I walk away.

speaker: PRINCE
text: With me in your company?

speaker: HERO
text: I may say so when I please.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And when please you to say so?

speaker: HERO
text: When I like your favor, for God defend the lute

speaker: HERO
text: should be like the case.

speaker: PRINCE
text: My visor is Philemon’s roof; within the house

speaker: PRINCE
text: is Jove.

speaker: HERO
text: Why, then, your visor should be thatched.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Speak low if you speak love.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Well, I would you did like me.

speaker: MARGARET
text: So would not I for your own sake, for I have

speaker: MARGARET
text: many ill qualities.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Which is one?

speaker: MARGARET
text: I say my prayers aloud.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I love you the better; the hearers may cry

speaker: BENEDICK
text: “Amen.”

speaker: MARGARET
text: God match me with a good dancer.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text: Amen.

speaker: MARGARET
text: And God keep him out of my sight when the

speaker: MARGARET
text: dance is done. Answer, clerk.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text: No more words. The clerk is answered.

speaker: URSULA
text: I know you well enough. You are Signior

speaker: URSULA
text: Antonio.

speaker: ANTONIO
text: At a word, I am not.

speaker: URSULA
text: I know you by the waggling of your head.

speaker: ANTONIO
text: To tell you true, I counterfeit him.

speaker: URSULA
text: You could never do him so ill-well unless you

speaker: URSULA
text: were the very man. Here’s his dry hand up and

speaker: URSULA
text: down. You are he, you are he.

speaker: ANTONIO
text: At a word, I am not.

speaker: URSULA
text: Come, come, do you think I do not know you

speaker: URSULA
text: by your excellent wit? Can virtue hide itself? Go to,

speaker: URSULA
text: mum, you are he. Graces will appear, and there’s an

speaker: URSULA
text: end.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Will you not tell me who told you so?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: No, you shall pardon me.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Nor will you not tell me who you are?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Not now.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: That I was disdainful, and that I had my

speaker: BEATRICE
text: good wit out of The Hundred Merry Tales! Well, this

speaker: BEATRICE
text: was Signior Benedick that said so.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: What’s he?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I am sure you know him well enough.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Not I, believe me.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Did he never make you laugh?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I pray you, what is he?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Why, he is the Prince’s jester, a very dull

speaker: BEATRICE
text: fool; only his gift is in devising impossible slanders.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: None but libertines delight in him, and the commendation

speaker: BEATRICE
text: is not in his wit but in his villainy, for he

speaker: BEATRICE
text: both pleases men and angers them, and then they

speaker: BEATRICE
text: laugh at him and beat him. I am sure he is in the

speaker: BEATRICE
text: fleet.I would he had boarded me.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: When I know the gentleman, I’ll tell him

speaker: BENEDICK
text: what you say.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Do, do. He’ll but break a comparison or two

speaker: BEATRICE
text: on me, which peradventure not marked or not

speaker: BEATRICE
text: laughed at strikes him into melancholy, and then

speaker: BEATRICE
text: there’s a partridge wing saved, for the fool will eat

speaker: BEATRICE
text:
no supper that night. 
                Music
                 
                for
                 
                the
                 
                dance
                .
               We must

speaker: BEATRICE
text: follow the leaders.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: In every good thing.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Nay, if they lead to any ill, I will leave them

speaker: BEATRICE
text: at the next turning.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Sure my brother is amorous

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: on Hero, and hath withdrawn her father to break

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: with him about it. The ladies follow her, and but one

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: visor remains.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: And that is Claudio. I know him by his

speaker: BORACHIO
text: bearing.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Are not you Signior Benedick?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: You know me well. I am he.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Signior, you are very near my brother in his

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: love. He is enamored on Hero. I pray you dissuade

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: him from her. She is no equal for his birth. You

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: may do the part of an honest man in it.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: How know you he loves her?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I heard him swear his affection.

speaker: BORACHIO
text: So did I too, and he swore he would marry

speaker: BORACHIO
text: her tonight.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Come, let us to the banquet.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Thus
               
              answer
               
              I
               
              in
               
              name
               
              of
               
              Benedick
              ,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
But
               
              hear
               
              these
               
              ill
               
              news
               
              with
               
              the
               
              ears
               
              of
               
              Claudio
              .

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
’Tis
               
              certain
               
              so
              .
               
              The
               
              Prince
               
              woos
               
              for
               
              himself
              .

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Friendship
               
              is
               
              constant
               
              in
               
              all
               
              other
               
              things

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Save
               
              in
               
              the
               
              office
               
              and
               
              affairs
               
              of
               
              love
              .

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Therefore
               
              all
               
              hearts
               
              in
               
              love
               
              use
               
              their
               
              own
               
              tongues
              .

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Let
               
              every
               
              eye
               
              negotiate
               
              for
               
              itself

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
And
               
              trust
               
              no
               
              agent
              ,
               
              for
               
              beauty
               
              is
               
              a
               
              witch

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Against
               
              whose
               
              charms
               
              faith
               
              melteth
               
              into
               
              blood
              .

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
This
               
              is
               
              an
               
              accident
               
              of
               
              hourly
               
              proof
              ,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text:
Which
               
              I
               
              mistrusted
               
              not
              .
               
              Farewell
               
              therefore
              ,
               
              Hero
              .

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Count Claudio?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Yea, the same.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Come, will you go with me?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Whither?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Even to the next willow, about your own

speaker: BENEDICK
text: business, county. What fashion will you wear the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: garland of? About your neck like an usurer’s chain?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Or under your arm like a lieutenant’s scarf? You

speaker: BENEDICK
text: must wear it one way, for the Prince hath got your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Hero.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I wish him joy of her.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Why, that’s spoken like an honest drover; so

speaker: BENEDICK
text: they sell bullocks. But did you think the Prince

speaker: BENEDICK
text: would have served you thus?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I pray you, leave me.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Ho, now you strike like the blind man.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: ’Twas the boy that stole your meat, and you’ll beat

speaker: BENEDICK
text: the post.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If it will not be, I’ll leave you.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Alas, poor hurt fowl, now will he creep into

speaker: BENEDICK
text: sedges. But that my Lady Beatrice should know

speaker: BENEDICK
text: me, and not know me! The Prince’s fool! Ha, it may

speaker: BENEDICK
text: be I go under that title because I am merry. Yea, but

speaker: BENEDICK
text: so I am apt to do myself wrong. I am not so reputed!

speaker: BENEDICK
text: It is the base, though bitter, disposition of Beatrice

speaker: BENEDICK
text: that puts the world into her person and so gives me

speaker: BENEDICK
text: out. Well, I’ll be revenged as I may.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Now, signior, where’s the Count? Did you see

speaker: PRINCE
text: him?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Troth, my lord, I have played the part of

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Lady Fame. I found him here as melancholy as a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: lodge in a warren. I told him, and I think I told him

speaker: BENEDICK
text: true, that your Grace had got the goodwill of this

speaker: BENEDICK
text: young lady, and I offered him my company to a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: willow tree, either to make him a garland, as being

speaker: BENEDICK
text: forsaken, or to bind him up a rod, as being worthy to

speaker: BENEDICK
text: be whipped.

speaker: PRINCE
text: To be whipped? What’s his fault?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: The flat transgression of a schoolboy who,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: being overjoyed with finding a bird’s nest, shows it

speaker: BENEDICK
text: his companion, and he steals it.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Wilt thou make a trust a transgression? The

speaker: PRINCE
text: transgression is in the stealer.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Yet it had not been amiss the rod had been

speaker: BENEDICK
text: made, and the garland too, for the garland he

speaker: BENEDICK
text: might have worn himself, and the rod he might

speaker: BENEDICK
text: have bestowed on you, who, as I take it, have stolen

speaker: BENEDICK
text: his bird’s nest.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I will but teach them to sing and restore them

speaker: PRINCE
text: to the owner.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: If their singing answer your saying, by my

speaker: BENEDICK
text: faith, you say honestly.

speaker: PRINCE
text: The Lady Beatrice hath a quarrel to you. The

speaker: PRINCE
text: gentleman that danced with her told her she is

speaker: PRINCE
text: much wronged by you.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: O, she misused me past the endurance of a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: block! An oak but with one green leaf on it would

speaker: BENEDICK
text: have answered her. My very visor began to assume

speaker: BENEDICK
text: life and scold with her. She told me, not thinking I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: had been myself, that I was the Prince’s jester, that I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: was duller than a great thaw, huddling jest upon jest

speaker: BENEDICK
text: with such impossible conveyance upon me that I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: stood like a man at a mark with a whole army

speaker: BENEDICK
text: shooting at me. She speaks poniards, and every

speaker: BENEDICK
text: word stabs. If her breath were as terrible as her

speaker: BENEDICK
text: terminations, there were no living near her; she

speaker: BENEDICK
text: would infect to the North Star. I would not marry

speaker: BENEDICK
text: her though she were endowed with all that Adam

speaker: BENEDICK
text: had left him before he transgressed. She would have

speaker: BENEDICK
text: made Hercules have turned spit, yea, and have cleft

speaker: BENEDICK
text: his club to make the fire, too. Come, talk not of her.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: You shall find her the infernal Ate in good apparel. I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: would to God some scholar would conjure her, for

speaker: BENEDICK
text: certainly, while she is here, a man may live as quiet

speaker: BENEDICK
text: in hell as in a sanctuary, and people sin upon

speaker: BENEDICK
text: purpose because they would go thither. So indeed

speaker: BENEDICK
text: all disquiet, horror, and perturbation follows her.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Look, here she comes.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Will your Grace command me any service

speaker: BENEDICK
text: to the world’s end? I will go on the slightest errand

speaker: BENEDICK
text: now to the Antipodes that you can devise to send

speaker: BENEDICK
text: me on. I will fetch you a toothpicker now from the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: furthest inch of Asia, bring you the length of Prester

speaker: BENEDICK
text: John’s foot, fetch you a hair off the great Cham’s

speaker: BENEDICK
text: beard, do you any embassage to the Pygmies, rather

speaker: BENEDICK
text: than hold three words’ conference with this harpy.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: You have no employment for me?

speaker: PRINCE
text: None but to desire your good company.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: O God, sir, here’s a dish I love not! I cannot

speaker: BENEDICK
text: endure my Lady Tongue.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Come, lady, come, you have lost

speaker: PRINCE
text: the heart of Signior Benedick.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Indeed, my lord, he lent it me awhile, and I

speaker: BEATRICE
text: gave him use for it, a double heart for his single

speaker: BEATRICE
text: one. Marry, once before he won it of me with false

speaker: BEATRICE
text: dice. Therefore your Grace may well say I have lost

speaker: BEATRICE
text: it.

speaker: PRINCE
text: You have put him down, lady, you have put

speaker: PRINCE
text: him down.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: So I would not he should do me, my lord,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: lest I should prove the mother of fools. I have

speaker: BEATRICE
text: brought Count Claudio, whom you sent me to seek.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, how now, count, wherefore are you sad?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Not sad, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: How then, sick?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Neither, my lord.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: The Count is neither sad, nor sick, nor merry,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: nor well, but civil count, civil as an orange, and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: something of that jealous complexion.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I’ faith, lady, I think your blazon to be true,

speaker: PRINCE
text: though I’ll be sworn, if he be so, his conceit is

speaker: PRINCE
text: false.—Here, Claudio, I have wooed in thy name,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and fair Hero is won. I have broke with her father

speaker: PRINCE
text: and his goodwill obtained. Name the day of marriage,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and God give thee joy.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Count, take of me my daughter, and with her

speaker: LEONATO
text: my fortunes. His Grace hath made the match, and

speaker: LEONATO
text: all grace say “Amen” to it.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Speak, count, ’tis your cue.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Silence is the perfectest herald of joy. I were

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: but little happy if I could say how much.—Lady, as

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: you are mine, I am yours. I give away myself for you

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: and dote upon the exchange.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Speak, cousin, or, if you cannot, stop his

speaker: BEATRICE
text: mouth with a kiss and let not him speak neither.

speaker: PRINCE
text: In faith, lady, you have a merry heart.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Yea, my lord. I thank it, poor fool, it keeps on

speaker: BEATRICE
text: the windy side of care. My cousin tells him in his ear

speaker: BEATRICE
text: that he is in her heart.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And so she doth, cousin.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Good Lord for alliance! Thus goes everyone

speaker: BEATRICE
text: to the world but I, and I am sunburnt. I may sit in a

speaker: BEATRICE
text: corner and cry “Heigh-ho for a husband!”

speaker: PRINCE
text: Lady Beatrice, I will get you one.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I would rather have one of your father’s

speaker: BEATRICE
text: getting. Hath your Grace ne’er a brother like you?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Your father got excellent husbands, if a maid could

speaker: BEATRICE
text: come by them.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Will you have me, lady?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: No, my lord, unless I might have another for

speaker: BEATRICE
text: working days. Your Grace is too costly to wear

speaker: BEATRICE
text: every day. But I beseech your Grace pardon me. I

speaker: BEATRICE
text: was born to speak all mirth and no matter.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Your silence most offends me, and to be merry

speaker: PRINCE
text: best becomes you, for out o’ question you were

speaker: PRINCE
text: born in a merry hour.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: No, sure, my lord, my mother cried, but then

speaker: BEATRICE
text: there was a star danced, and under that was I

speaker: BEATRICE
text: born.—Cousins, God give you joy!

speaker: LEONATO
text: Niece, will you look to those things I told

speaker: LEONATO
text: you of?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I cry you mercy, uncle.—By your Grace’s

speaker: BEATRICE
text: pardon.

speaker: PRINCE
text: By my troth, a pleasant-spirited lady.

speaker: LEONATO
text: There’s little of the melancholy element in

speaker: LEONATO
text: her, my lord. She is never sad but when she sleeps,

speaker: LEONATO
text: and not ever sad then, for I have heard my daughter

speaker: LEONATO
text: say she hath often dreamt of unhappiness and

speaker: LEONATO
text: waked herself with laughing.

speaker: PRINCE
text: She cannot endure to hear tell of a husband.

speaker: LEONATO
text: O, by no means. She mocks all her wooers

speaker: LEONATO
text: out of suit.

speaker: PRINCE
text: She were an excellent wife for Benedick.

speaker: LEONATO
text: O Lord, my lord, if they were but a week

speaker: LEONATO
text: married, they would talk themselves mad.

speaker: PRINCE
text: County Claudio, when mean you to go to

speaker: PRINCE
text: church?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Tomorrow, my lord. Time goes on crutches

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: till love have all his rites.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Not till Monday, my dear son, which is hence

speaker: LEONATO
text: a just sevennight, and a time too brief, too, to have

speaker: LEONATO
text: all things answer my mind.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Come, you shake the head at so

speaker: PRINCE
text: long a breathing, but I warrant thee, Claudio, the

speaker: PRINCE
text: time shall not go dully by us. I will in the interim

speaker: PRINCE
text: undertake one of Hercules’ labors, which is to bring

speaker: PRINCE
text: Signior Benedick and the Lady Beatrice into a

speaker: PRINCE
text: mountain of affection, th’ one with th’ other. I

speaker: PRINCE
text: would fain have it a match, and I doubt not but to

speaker: PRINCE
text: fashion it, if you three will but minister such

speaker: PRINCE
text: assistance as I shall give you direction.

speaker: LEONATO
text: My lord, I am for you, though it cost me ten

speaker: LEONATO
text: nights’ watchings.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And I, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And you too, gentle Hero?

speaker: HERO
text: I will do any modest office, my lord, to help my

speaker: HERO
text: cousin to a good husband.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And Benedick is not the unhopefullest husband

speaker: PRINCE
text: that I know. Thus far can I praise him: he is of

speaker: PRINCE
text: a noble strain, of approved valor, and confirmed

speaker: PRINCE
text: honesty. I will teach you how to humor your

speaker: PRINCE
text: cousin that she shall fall in love with Benedick.—

speaker: PRINCE
text: And I, with your two helps, will so practice on

speaker: PRINCE
text: Benedick that, in despite of his quick wit and his

speaker: PRINCE
text: queasy stomach, he shall fall in love with Beatrice.

speaker: PRINCE
text: If we can do this, Cupid is no longer an archer; his

speaker: PRINCE
text: glory shall be ours, for we are the only love gods. Go

speaker: PRINCE
text: in with me, and I will tell you my drift.
